screenplay.rawText:
INT. JASON'S ART STUDIO - DAY
Jason, Stacey, and Catherine discuss the commission contract with unusual requirements: cash-only, NDA, three marketing events, and a high payment that raises suspicion.
actions: Jason waits in his art studio surrounded by his paintings.
Stacey Morrison prepares interview equipment and mics Jason.
Jason shows Catherine the painting 'Burst of Life.'
They sit to discuss the contract.
Catherine reveals an unusual commission deal involving cash, NDA, documentary filming, and marketing events.
Catherine stacks cash on the table in neat piles.

lines: I just need to clip this mic to your shirt.
Okay.. Give me a mic check.
I call this one Burst of Life.
It says here painting price blank? Documentary price blank?
So she’s going to be following me through the whole process?
I don’t know if I should be happy, or offended.
Why is there a blank space here for a bonus payout?
Yes, of course we have a deal.
Pleased to finally meet you face-to-face.
I bet you’re wondering why we set this all up just to discuss a potential painting commission?
Franklin B. Stevenson loves your Illustrated Abstractions and wants to buy the next piece.
Franklin pays in cash. Will that be okay?
All of Mr. Stevenson's requests are in this contract.
Yes, Franklin wants to see the painting out in the world before he takes possession.
We’re offering ten thousand for the painting.
Another five thousand if you finish in two weeks.
This will all be yours if you can stick to the contract.
Sign the contract and we’ll get started.
This is only the bonus portion of the deal.
You cannot spend any of this cash until the contract is fulfilled.
Hi Catherine, nice to see you too!

narrative.summary: Jason meets with art dealer Catherine Thompson to discuss a mysterious commission. The buyer offers unusually high payment, insists on cash-only, three marketing events, an NDA, and full documentary coverage. Jason is excited but uneasy.
narrative.beatPurpose: Explain how Jason got involved in a dangerous and suspicious commission; contrast with the opening chase scene.
narrative.conflict: Increasingly strange contract conditions create tension and suspicion.
narrative.stakes: Jason’s career, personal safety, financial entanglement, legal risk via strict NDA.
narrative.outcome: Jason signs the contract, setting the plot in motion.

revealedBackstory: Jason has a signature painting series: Illustrated Abstractions.
Franklin B. Stevenson is an influential buyer.

continuityLinks: This explains why Jason is later running with the painting in Scene 1.
Establishes the NDA and dangerous contract terms.
